page.title: 19Post-Excavation Prognosis
page.content: The fields around East Goscote have now been back-filled and the most recent excavations to the west of Cossington are now being back filled, after each section has been mined. Lorry movements have been reduced to a minimum by the use of a conveyor-belt running beneath the (B5328),and trees planted to form a screen between sand and gravel pits and village of cossington are growing well to hide the workings. The area is having to suffer temporary upheaval in order to supply builders with sand and gravel, the fears that were initially expressed, concerning the damage to the enviroment,have not been realised,and the future should see the re-instatementof the lush green water meadows that,before excavation,had lain undisturbed since the first domes day book was compiled.See pages 17,18.
